ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to other students.
I would definitely recommend this class. Classes like this do not come around enough here at Yale.
This is a fantastic course, but just make sure that the other students taking it will make it worth your time. Otherwise, just do the readings on your own.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As I said above, I feel like we really got to delve into the works of specific women with the "great works" approach, but I would have appreciated the opportunity to read more broadly in the field to get a better sense of the different strands of black feminism and its major debates and change over time.

This class helped me develop a stronger black feminist and womanist lens of analysis, especially with regards to erotic practice/methodology, a concept I have begun to work with this year (beginning in Professor Allen's class) in my analysis of artistic production and visual/material culture in America from 1890-present.
This course gave me the tools and readings I needed to further my current research interests.
